generif.text: NUP98 primer and a degenerate primer corresponding to the third helix of the homeodomain of HOXA demonstrated that NUP98 was fused in-frame to HOXA11 in the patient with CML ( chronic myelogenous leukemia)
expressed in the developing kidney
HOXA gene expression is up-regulated at the ectopic implantation site in the fallopian tube and it may play a role in ectopic pregnancies.
study reveals a novel expression pattern for homeo box A11(HOXA11) gene in human endometrium

The HOXA11 gene cluster is in T-cell malignancies resulting in deregulated HOXA gene expression and is in keeping with a previous report suggesting HOXA deregulation in MLL-rearranged T cell lymphoblastic leukemia.
HOXA10 and HOXA11 expression increases during the menstrual cycle, increasing drastically in the midluteal phase, at the time of implantation.
HOXA11 is critical for development and maintenance of uterosacral ligaments and deficient in pelvic prolapse.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Our findings do not support the hypothesis that mutations in the HOXA11 coding regions are involved in the pathogenesis of human non-syndromal congenital renal parenchymal malformations.
Expression of HOXA11 represses the expression of p53 in uterosacral ligaments.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Methylation of HOXA11 gene is associated with high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions in cervical cancer

HoxA-11 is required for prolactin expression in decidualized embryonic stem cells and turns into an activator when combined with FOXO1A; HOXA-10 is unable to upregulate PRL expression when co-expressed with FOXO1A
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
No subject with female genital tract anomalies showed a plausible causative mutation in HOX A10 or HOX A11.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Our results suggest that altered HOXA11 gene expression in the endometrium during a menstrual cycle may be a common phenomenon among patients with endometriosis and may cause infertility in this group of patients
The result suggest that HOXA-11 gene expression in the endometrium during the implantation window may not be altered in patients with idiopathic infertility.

Endometrial HOXA11 and LIF mRNA expression levels (normalized to beta-actin expression) were significantly decreased in endometrium of infertile patients with endometriosis compared with healthy fertile controls
reduced HOXA11 expression may contribute to endometriosis-associated infertility

Data show that up-regulation of the HOXA7, HOXA9, HOXA11, and PBX3 resulting from the down-regulation of miR-181 family members probably contribute to the poor prognosis of patients with nonfavorable cytogenetically abnormal AML (CA-AML).
Promoter methylation of HOXA11 is associated with glioblastoma.
Lower expression of HOXA11 is associated with endometriosis-associated infertility.
Study suggests that HOXA11 hypermethylation may contribute to the progression of NSCLC by promoting cell proliferation or migration.
Low HOXA11 expression is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma.
Mutations in the coding region of HOXA11 are not common in Chinese women with Mullerian duct anomalies.
Epigenetic silencing of HOXA11 promotes gastric cancer proliferation, migration and invasion through activation of Wnt signaling.
The overexpression of miR-30d or 181a suppressed HOXA11 mRNA.
Laparoscopic endometrioma resection increases peri-implantation endometrial HOXA-11 mRNA expression.

Regulated HOXA10 and HOXA11 expression is necessary for endometrial receptivity; decreased HOXA10 or HOXA11 expression leads to decreased implantation rates. Alternation of HOXA10 and HOXA11 expression has been identified as a mechanism of the decreased implantation associated with endometriosis, polycystic ovarian syndrome, leiomyoma, polyps, adenomyosis, and hydrosalpinx.
The treatment resistance induced by the underexpression of HOXA11 can contribute to a poor prognosis in GBM.
Hypermethylation of HOXA11 is an independent prognostic biomarker in breast cancer. Suggest HOXA11 as a potential tumor suppressor.

These results suggest that mutations in the coding sequence of HOXA11 might not be a common cause of cryptorchidism, while common polymorphisms in the HOXA11 gene might contribute to the risk of developing unilateral cryptorchidism.

We conclude that the expression patterns of HoxA10, HoxA11, and HoxA13 and their actions in regulating CAP genes in the uterus create regionalized myometrium phenotypes in women that may be important to control regionalized myometrium contractility for maintaining pregnancy.
Results show that aberrant hypermethylation and the methylation-induced down-regulation of HOXA11 may promote lung adenocarcinoma progression.
our study demonstrated that HOXA11 function as a tumor suppressor in renal cell carcinoma
HOXA11 silencing suppressed osteosarcoma cell proliferation, invasion and induced cell arrest.
High expression of lncRNA HOXA11-AS promotes breast cancer invasion and metastasis by affecting EMT.
demonstrated that HOXA11-antisense(AS) functioned as a molecular sponge for miR-124, and overexpression of miR-124 attenuated the proliferation and invasion-promoting effect of HOXA11-AS
Bioinformatics prediction forecast that miR-140-5p directly targeted HOXA11-antisense RNA at 3'-UTR, which was confirmed by luciferase reporter assay
HOXA11-AS functions as a competing endogenous RNA.

we uncovered a novel potential regulatory mechanism between HOTTIP and one of its physical HOXA clusters, HOXA11. Hence, HOTTIP may mediate, at least partly, HOXA11 expression involved in cell growth, migration, and apoptosis of breast cancer MCF-7 cells.
HOXA11 high expression might lead to the occurrence and development of lung squamous cancer.
HOXA11-AS regulates diabetic arteriosclerosis-related inflammation via PI3K/AKT pathway

Study found that HOXA11 is hypermethylated and significantly downregulated in cisplatin resistant lung adenocarcinoma tumors and cell lines and that the 5-aza-CdR treatment restores HOXA11 expression and reverses the hypermethylation of CpG islands.
HOXA11-AS induced collagen synthesis via sponging miR-124-3p-mediated Smad5 signaling in keloid cells.
HOXA11-AS could inhibit miR-124 expression by binding to EZH2 and thus promoted the migration and invasion of HCC cells.
Abnormal methylation levels of the HOXA10 and HOXA11 promoters were found in the endometrium of women with tubal infertility and repeated implantation failures.
Correlation of miR-181a and three HOXA genes as useful biomarkers in acute myeloid leukemia.
A self-enforcing HOXA11/Stat3 feedback loop promotes stemness properties and peritoneal metastasis in gastric cancer cells.
Study suggested that HOXA11-AS silencing exerts an antitumor effect, suppressing HCC development via Wnt signaling pathway inactivation by decreasing the methylation level of the HOXA11 promoter.
Laparoscopic Ovarian Drilling Improves Endometrial Homeobox Gene Expression in PCOS.
A homozygous HOXA11 variation as a potential novel cause of autosomal recessive congenital anomalies of the kidney and urinary tract.
Long noncoding RNA HOXA11AS accelerates cell proliferation and epithelialmesenchymal transition in hepatocellular carcinoma by modulating the miR5063p/Slug axis.
Molecular mechanism of extracellular matrix disorder in pelvic organ prolapses.
HOXA11 plays critical roles in disease progression and response to cytarabine in AML.
Combined expression of HOXA11 and CD10 identifies endometriosis versus normal tissue and tumors.
The lncRNA HOXA11-AS acts as a tumor promoter in breast cancer through regulation of the miR-125a-5p/TMPRSS4 axis.
Decreased expression of transcription factor Homeobox A11 and its potential target genes in bladder cancer.
lncRNA HOXA11-AS maintains the stemness of oral squamous cell carcinoma stem cells and reduces the radiosensitivity by targeting miR-518a-3p/PDK1.
Cooperation between NSPc1 and DNA methylation represses HOXA11 expression and promotes apoptosis of trophoblast cells during preeclampsia.
Endometrial Injury Upregulates Expression of Receptivity Genes in Women with Implantation Failure.
Tumor-mesothelium HOXA11-PDGF BB/TGF beta1-miR-181a-5p-Egr1 feedforward amplifier circuity propels mesothelial fibrosis and peritoneal metastasis of gastric cancer.

interpro.desc: Domain of unknown function DUF3528, homeobox protein, eukaryotic

name: homeobox A11

kegg.name: Transcriptional misregulation in cancer - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: In vertebrates, the genes encoding the class of transcription factors called homeobox genes are found in clusters named A, B, C, and D on four separate chromosomes. Expression of these proteins is spatially and temporally regulated during embryonic development. This gene is part of the A cluster on chromosome 7 and encodes a DNA-binding transcription factor which may regulate gene expression, morphogenesis, and differentiation. This gene is involved in the regulation of uterine development and is required for female fertility. Mutations in this gene can cause radio-ulnar synostosis with amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
